intro: Kengyilia thoroldiana, commonly known as the Tibetan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at elevations between 3,000 and 5,000 meters. Its leaves are usually basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Kengyilia thoroldiana is adapted to cold climates and has a limited distribution due to its specific ecological requirements.
